title.native: 蒼穹のファフナー BEHIND THE LINE
title.romaji: Soukyuu no Fafner: BEHIND THE LINE

description:
Announced at the Soushi Minashiro Birthday Fes 2021. Initially promised to fans during the 2017 birthday event, this self-contained entry to the Fafner series will be a "peaceful spinoff".

(Source: Anime News Network, edited)
synonyms: Fafner of the Blue Sky: Behind the Line

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

name.native: オルガ・カティーナ・ベトレンコ

node.description: angela is a Japanese pop band. The main members are Yamashita Atsuko (artist name "atsuko") and Hirasato Katsunori (artist name "KATSU").

Ubukata was exposed to a blending of cultures from early childhood until the age of fourteen, having lived in Singapore and Nepal because of his father's work. In 1996, while in college, Ubukata won the first Sneaker Taisho Gold Prize for his light novel Kuroi Kisetsu, and thus debuted as a writer. In 2003, he won the Nihon SF Taisho Award for Mardock Scramble, originally published as a three-volume series. He is involved in a wide range of projects including anime production for Fafner, video game production, and original content writing for comics such as Le Chevalier D'Eon. His other works include the Bye-Bye Earth and Spiegel novel series. In 2009, he published his first historical novel, Tenchi Meisatsu, focusing on a mathematician of the Edo period.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/平井久司)

__Hisashi Hirai__ is a Japanese animator, designer, illustrator and mangaka. He is best known for his character design work on [Gundam SEED](https://anilist.co/anime/93/Mobile-Suit-Gundam-Seed/) and the Fafner series.

Currently a freelancer. He began his career as an in-betweener for [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production) and debuted in the 1983 TV series, [Cat's Eye](https://anilist.co/anime/2043/Cats-Eye/). He often worked on many outsourced episodes for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) shows as a key animator and animation director.

In 1992 he would work on [Dragon Slayer](https://anilist.co/anime/3025/Dragon-Slayer/). An animated adaptation of the 1989 video game Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes by Nihon Falcom, his first major character design credit. Since then, he became more active as a character designer on numerous series. Most notably for Sunrise productions such as [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/Infinite-Ryvius/), [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/), and the aforementioned Gundam SEED series; which he had won the Character Design Prize for at the 3rd Tokyo International Anime Fair in 2004.

Hirai is also said to be a close friend of director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi).
Washio is a mechanical designer. Graduated from Tokyo Design College. His favourite animation is The Powerpuff Girls.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

__[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/saito/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斉藤恒芳)__

__Tsuneyoshi Saito__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He has composed for several anime series, films, and TV dramas.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gonakanishi)

Gou Nakanishi graduated with a degree from Waseda University's Faculty of Letter's, Arts and Sciences. Starting his career with King Records in 1997, he has been instrumental in developing popular artistes and anime hits such as Sokyuu no Fafner, Inukami and Negima!? He is also the producer of the hit Japanese pop band, angela.

name.native: ワルシャワ国立フィルハーモニー管弦楽団

node.description:
[Official Website](http://www.filharmonia.pl/strona-glowna_en) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/FilharmoniaNarodowa) | [Facebook]() | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/WarsawPhil) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/warsawphil/)

The Warsaw National Philharmonic Orchestra is a Polish orchestra based in Warsaw. Founded in 1901, it is one of Poland's oldest musical institutions.

The Philharmonic has recorded music for several anime series. Notable shows include Gankutsuou: The Count of Monte Cristo, Cowboy Bebop, Soukyuu no Fafner, Giant Robo: The Animation, Ah! My Goddess: The Movie, Princess Nine, Vision of Escaflowne, Wolf's Rain, Hellsing Ultimate, Genesis of Aquarion,[7] and more recently, Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood. It has also recorded music for Namco's Ace Combat 5: The Unsung War, and together with the Hollywood Session Orchestra, for the SEGA action-RPG Phantasy Star Universe. The orchestra was involved in a major performance for the film Avalon, composed by Kenji Kawai, and part of a performance is shown in the film. It also played the soundtrack for the film Battle Royale. Most recently, they have recorded music for the Square Enix role-playing video game Final Fantasy XIII.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/平井久司)
